results.title: The Licorice train
results.creator_credit: Cinemusic Productions, Stanley Woodward and Stephen M. Gould
results.brief_description: A ghetto youth journeys, via elevated train, into neighbourhoods vastly different from his own and indulges in various fantasies about what life is and might be like. The sound track consists of a musical score whose sweet, sentimental melody and lyrics make an ironic contrast to the grim realities of the boy’s existence.

results.title: The Lickerish quartet
results.brief_description: This erotic fantasy film is set in an ancient Italian castle where a man and woman live with her adult son. Opening with the family viewing a pornographic movie and commenting on it, the trio then venture out to the local carnival where they meet the star of the movie now working as a motorcycle stuntwoman. They invite the woman back to the house to have a ‘party’ and watch the film together. Bizarrely she is no longer in the film and has been replaced. One by one the mysterious blonde seduces each of the family members resulting a sexual awakening for all of them, until in the end, physical reality is lost to them and they too become part of movie for others to watch. Highly stylised sets, costumes and funky music add to the swinging sixties feel of this Radley Metzger fantasy romp. Based on the story “Hide and Seek” by Michael De Forrest and Radley Metzger. Cast includes Silvana Venturelli, Frank Wolff, Erika Remberg, Paolo Turco.

results.title: The Library story
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Milan Herzog
results.brief_description: Shows the various services provided by a modern public library. It dwells in the varied interests of regular readers, children, teenagers, blind people and those interested in music. Illustrates the various rooms and parts of the library which include a children’s room, a conference room, a reference room, the catalogue and facilities for reading microfilm.

results.title: The Library is...
results.creator_credit: Wayne Films, Bro-Dart Industries and Leonard Peck
results.brief_description: Illustrates the history, philosophy, purposes, services and the rewards of libraries. In an interesting blend of ancient and modern, the entire sweep of recorded information - from clay tablets to computers - is pictured. At the same time the beauty of books as works of art is not forgotten. What is means to be a librarian is emphasised throughout the film. Narrated by Lester Rawlins.

results.title: The Liberated letter
results.creator_credit: Letraset International, Formula One Films, American Library Association and John Mills
results.brief_description: Presents a brief history of the development of lettering, the invention of the printing press and the more recent invention of phototypesetting. Shows the production of Letraset instant lettering and some of the styles available.

results.title: The Liberals
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation, Bruce Belsham and Tim Clark
results.brief_description: This is a dramatic documentary of the 50 year history of the Federal Liberal Party in Australia. Beginning with the formation of the party, which first swept to office in 1949 at the height of the Second World War, led by the charismatic Robert Menzies and follows its transistion through the leaderships of Harold Holt, John Gorton and William McMahon; and the turmoil of the Vietnam War. After 23 years the Liberals lost office in 1972 only to regain it again in 1975 under the leadership of Malcolm Fraser. It delves into the turbulent internal atmosphere which has existed within the party since the rejection of Fraser as leader, looking at the leaderships of John Howard, Andrew Peacock and John Hewson and the “Fightback” package. This is the history of the Federal Liberal Party until the loss of the 1993 election and the appointmen of a new leader, Alexander Downer.

results.title: The Libby Hathorn video
results.creator_credit: Insight Profile, Christine McCaul Gleitzman and Mark Waters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Insight profile”.
Novelist and poet Libby Hathorn shares her inspiration and ideas which influence her writing. Life experiences, landscapes and locations are the focal point of her discussion, as she explains how being a writer does not just mean putting words on paper. A good writer is one who can explain an image so that it can become anything once it is published. A poem can become a painting, a novel can become a film. She explains that she sees the writer as the artist, and the reader as the audience.

results.title: The Libby Gleeson video
results.creator_credit: Insight Profile, Christine McCaul Gleitzman and Mark Waters
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Insight profile”.
Writer Libby Gleeson talks of the inspiration behind her novels, the experiences and settings in the environment around her and how they inform the realistic nature of her fiction writing. She discusses the importance of a credible “place” and how environment has shaped the characters in her novels - decision making on how to decide on point of view and how it’s influenced by the text is also covered. The importance of research, in particular in the classroom and in the schoolyard is mentioned, as well as issues throughout her novels. A brief biographical background and the business end of publication is also provided.

results.title: The Letter: a film about legal rights. - [Serbian version].
results.creator_credit: Film Victoria, Legal Aid Commission of Victoria, Richard Jones and Aleksi Vellis
results.brief_description: A guide to the basic legal rights, entitlements and responsibilities of people living in Australia, particularly non-English speaking migrants. The laws relating to business, presumption of innocence, issues relating to employee/employer relations, financial support, racism, anti-discrimination and tenancy laws are discussed. Illustrates differences between legal rights in Australia and in other countries. Dubbed in Serbian.
